## üè† Local Development

### Prerequisites
```bash
Node.js 18+ installed
npm or pnpm package manager
```

### Setup & Run
```bash
# Navigate to frontend directory
cd /workspace/chasemycareer/frontend

# Install dependencies (if not already done)
npm install

# Start development server
npm run dev

# Access at: http://localhost:5173
```

### Development Commands
```bash
# Start dev server with hot reload
npm run dev

# Build for production
npm run build

# Preview production build locally
npm run preview

# Run linter
npm run lint

# Type check
npm run type-check
```

---

## üåê Production Deployment

### Option 1: Vercel (Recommended)

**Why Vercel?**
- Zero configuration for Vite apps
- Automatic HTTPS
- Global CDN
- Serverless functions support
- Free tier available

**Deployment Steps:**

1. **Install Vercel CLI**
```bash
npm install -g vercel
```

2. **Login to Vercel**
```bash
vercel login
```

3. **Deploy from project root**
```bash
cd /workspace/chasemycareer/frontend
vercel
```

4. **Follow prompts:**
   - Set up and deploy? **Yes**
   - Which scope? **Your account**
   - Link to existing project? **No**
   - Project name? **chase-my-career**
   - Directory? **./frontend** (or current directory if already in frontend)
   - Override settings? **No**

5. **Configure Environment Variables in Vercel Dashboard:**
   - Go to Project Settings ‚Üí Environment Variables
   - Add:
     ```
     VITE_SUPABASE_URL=your_supabase_url
     VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your_supabase_anon_key
     VITE_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID=your_google_client_id (optional)
     ```

6. **Deploy to Production:**
```bash
vercel --prod
```

**Vercel Configuration File (vercel.json):**
```json
{
  "buildCommand": "npm run build",
  "outputDirectory": "dist",
  "devCommand": "npm run dev",
  "installCommand": "npm install",
  "framework": "vite",
  "rewrites": [
    {
      "source": "/(.*)",
      "destination": "/index.html"
    }
  ]
}
```

---

### Option 2: Netlify

**Why Netlify?**
- Simple drag-and-drop deployment
- Automatic HTTPS
- Form handling
- Split testing
- Free tier available

**Deployment Steps:**

**Method A: Netlify CLI**

1. **Install Netlify CLI**
```bash
npm install -g netlify-cli
```

2. **Login to Netlify**
```bash
netlify login
```

3. **Initialize and Deploy**
```bash
cd /workspace/chasemycareer/frontend
netlify init
```

4. **Follow prompts:**
   - Create & configure a new site
   - Build command: `npm run build`
   - Publish directory: `dist`

5. **Deploy**
```bash
netlify deploy --prod
```

**Method B: Netlify Dashboard**

1. Go to https://app.netlify.com
2. Click "Add new site" ‚Üí "Import an existing project"
3. Connect your Git repository
4. Configure build settings:
   - Build command: `npm run build`
   - Publish directory: `dist`
   - Base directory: `frontend`
5. Add environment variables in Site Settings
6. Click "Deploy site"

**Netlify Configuration File (netlify.toml):**
```toml
[build]
  command = "npm run build"
  publish = "dist"
  base = "frontend"

[[redirects]]
  from = "/*"
  to = "/index.html"
  status = 200

[build.environment]
  NODE_VERSION = "18"
```

---

### Option 3: GitHub Pages

**Deployment Steps:**

1. **Install gh-pages package**
```bash
npm install --save-dev gh-pages
```

2. **Add deploy script to package.json**
```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "predeploy": "npm run build",
    "deploy": "gh-pages -d dist"
  }
}
```

3. **Update vite.config.ts for GitHub Pages**
```typescript
export default defineConfig({
  base: '/chase-my-career/', // Replace with your repo name
  // ... rest of config
});
```

4. **Deploy**
```bash
npm run deploy
```

5. **Enable GitHub Pages**
   - Go to repository Settings ‚Üí Pages
   - Source: Deploy from branch
   - Branch: gh-pages
   - Folder: / (root)

---

### Option 4: AWS S3 + CloudFront

**Deployment Steps:**

1. **Build the application**
```bash
npm run build
```

2. **Create S3 Bucket**
```bash
aws s3 mb s3://chase-my-career
```

3. **Configure bucket for static website hosting**
```bash
aws s3 website s3://chase-my-career \
  --index-document index.html \
  --error-document index.html
```

4. **Upload build files**
```bash
aws s3 sync dist/ s3://chase-my-career --delete
```

5. **Set up CloudFront distribution** (optional, for CDN)
   - Create distribution pointing to S3 bucket
   - Configure custom error responses (404 ‚Üí /index.html)
   - Add SSL certificate

---

### Option 5: Docker Deployment

**Dockerfile:**
```dockerfile
# Build stage
FROM node:18-alpine AS builder

WORKDIR /app

# Copy package files
COPY package*.json ./

# Install dependencies
RUN npm ci

# Copy source code
COPY . .

# Build application
RUN npm run build

# Production stage
FROM nginx:alpine

# Copy built files
COPY --from=builder /app/dist /usr/share/nginx/html

# Copy nginx configuration
COPY nginx.conf /etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf

EXPOSE 80

CMD ["nginx", "-g", "daemon off;"]
```

**nginx.conf:**
```nginx
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name localhost;
    root /usr/share/nginx/html;
    index index.html;

    location / {
        try_files $uri $uri/ /index.html;
    }

    # Cache static assets
    location ~* \.(js|css|png|jpg|jpeg|gif|ico|svg)$ {
        expires 1y;
        add_header Cache-Control "public, immutable";
    }
}
```

**Build and Run:**
```bash
# Build Docker image
docker build -t chase-my-career .

# Run container
docker run -p 8080:80 chase-my-career

# Access at: http://localhost:8080
```

---

## üîß Environment Variables

### Required Variables
```env
# Supabase Configuration (REQUIRED)
VITE_SUPABASE_URL=https://your-project.supabase.co
VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your-anon-key-here

# Google OAuth (OPTIONAL)
VITE_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID=your-google-client-id

# Application Settings (OPTIONAL)
VITE_APP_NAME=Chase My Career
VITE_APP_URL=https://your-domain.com
```

### How to Set Environment Variables

**Vercel:**
- Dashboard ‚Üí Project ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Environment Variables

**Netlify:**
- Dashboard ‚Üí Site Settings ‚Üí Build & Deploy ‚Üí Environment

**GitHub Pages:**
- Use GitHub Secrets for sensitive data
- Access via GitHub Actions

**Docker:**
```bash
docker run -p 8080:80 \
  -e VITE_SUPABASE_URL=your_url \
  -e VITE_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=your_key \
  chase-my-career
```

## üß™ Testing Production Build Locally

### Method 1: Using Vite Preview
```bash
# Build the application
npm run build

# Preview the production build
npm run preview

# Access at: http://localhost:4173
```

### Method 2: Using serve package
```bash
# Install serve globally
npm install -g serve

# Serve the dist folder
serve -s dist -p 3000

# Access at: http://localhost:3000
```

### Method 3: Using Python HTTP Server
```bash
cd dist
python3 -m http.server 8000

# Access at: http://localhost:8000
```

## ‚úÖ Pre-Deployment Checklist

### Code Quality
- [ ] All tests passing
- [ ] Lint checks passing (`npm run lint`)
- [ ] TypeScript compilation successful
- [ ] No console errors in production build
- [ ] Build completes successfully

### Configuration
- [ ] Environment variables configured
- [ ] Supabase URL and keys set
- [ ] OAuth providers configured (if using)
- [ ] API endpoints verified
- [ ] CORS settings configured

### Supabase Setup
- [ ] Database migrations applied
- [ ] Row Level Security policies enabled
- [ ] OAuth providers configured in Supabase
- [ ] Storage buckets created (if needed)
- [ ] Edge functions deployed (if any)

### Performance
- [ ] Images optimized
- [ ] Code splitting implemented
- [ ] Lazy loading configured
- [ ] Bundle size acceptable (<1MB)
- [ ] Lighthouse score checked

### Security
- [ ] Environment variables not exposed
- [ ] API keys secured
- [ ] HTTPS enabled
- [ ] Security headers configured
- [ ] Content Security Policy set

### Functionality
- [ ] User registration works
- [ ] Login/logout works
- [ ] OAuth flows work (if configured)
- [ ] All pages accessible
- [ ] Forms submit correctly
- [ ] Data persists to database
- [ ] Admin features work (if admin)

## üîç Troubleshooting

### Build Fails

**Issue:** `npm run build` fails with errors

**Solutions:**
```bash
# Clear cache and reinstall
rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json
npm install

# Clear Vite cache
rm -rf node_modules/.vite

# Try building again
npm run build
```

### Environment Variables Not Working

**Issue:** App can't connect to Supabase

**Solutions:**
1. Verify `.env` file exists in frontend directory
2. Check variable names start with `VITE_`
3. Restart dev server after changing .env
4. For production, set variables in hosting platform dashboard

### Routing Issues (404 on Refresh)

**Issue:** Page refreshes result in 404 errors

**Solutions:**

**Vercel:** Add `vercel.json`:
```json
{
  "rewrites": [{ "source": "/(.*)", "destination": "/index.html" }]
}
```

**Netlify:** Add `_redirects` file in `public/`:
```
/*    /index.html   200
```

**Nginx:** Configure try_files:
```nginx
location / {
    try_files $uri $uri/ /index.html;
}
```

### Large Bundle Size Warning

**Issue:** Warning about chunks larger than 500 kB

**Solutions:**
1. This is a warning, not an error - app still works
2. To optimize, implement code splitting:
```typescript
// Use dynamic imports for large pages
const Dashboard = lazy(() => import('./pages/Dashboard'));
```

### CORS Errors

**Issue:** API requests blocked by CORS

**Solutions:**
1. Configure allowed origins in Supabase Dashboard
2. Add your production domain to allowed origins
3. Verify API URL is correct

---

## üìä Performance Optimization

### Recommended Optimizations

1. **Enable Compression**
   - Gzip/Brotli compression on server
   - Already configured for Vercel/Netlify

2. **Set Cache Headers**
```nginx
# Cache static assets for 1 year
location ~* \.(js|css|png|jpg|jpeg|gif|ico|svg)$ {
    expires 1y;
    add_header Cache-Control "public, immutable";
}
```

3. **Use CDN**
   - Vercel and Netlify include CDN
   - For custom hosting, use CloudFront or Cloudflare

4. **Lazy Load Images**
```tsx
<img loading="lazy" src="..." alt="..." />
```

5. **Code Splitting**
   - Already implemented with React.lazy()
   - Routes are automatically split

---

## üîê Security Best Practices

### Production Security Checklist

- [ ] Use HTTPS only
- [ ] Set secure environment variables
- [ ] Enable CORS restrictions
- [ ] Implement rate limiting (Supabase)
- [ ] Use Row Level Security (RLS)
- [ ] Sanitize user inputs
- [ ] Keep dependencies updated
- [ ] Monitor for vulnerabilities

### Security Headers

Add these headers in your hosting platform:

```
X-Frame-Options: DENY
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
Referrer-Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
Permissions-Policy: geolocation=(), microphone=(), camera=()
```

**Vercel (vercel.json):**
```json
{
  "headers": [
    {
      "source": "/(.*)",
      "headers": [
        { "key": "X-Frame-Options", "value": "DENY" },
        { "key": "X-Content-Type-Options", "value": "nosniff" }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

## üìà Monitoring & Analytics

### Recommended Tools

1. **Vercel Analytics** (if using Vercel)
   - Automatic performance monitoring
   - Real user metrics

2. **Google Analytics**
   - Add tracking code to index.html
   - Track user behavior

3. **Sentry** (Error Tracking)
```bash
npm install @sentry/react
```

4. **Supabase Dashboard**
   - Monitor database queries
   - Check API usage
   - View logs

## üéØ Post-Deployment Steps

### After Successful Deployment

1. **Verify Deployment**
   - [ ] Visit production URL
   - [ ] Test user registration
   - [ ] Test login/logout
   - [ ] Check all pages load
   - [ ] Test form submissions

2. **Configure Domain** (if custom domain)
   - [ ] Add DNS records
   - [ ] Enable SSL certificate
   - [ ] Verify HTTPS works
   - [ ] Update OAuth redirect URLs

3. **Update Supabase**
   - [ ] Add production URL to allowed origins
   - [ ] Update OAuth redirect URLs
   - [ ] Configure email templates

4. **Monitor Performance**
   - [ ] Check Lighthouse score
   - [ ] Monitor error rates
   - [ ] Track user analytics
   - [ ] Review server logs

5. **Backup & Recovery**
   - [ ] Set up database backups
   - [ ] Document recovery procedures
   - [ ] Test restore process
